headline: Diversity and culture exposure
pros: Great WFH policy. Generous benefits and compensation. Collaboration with several other international cultures allows for personal development and sensitivity. Continuous learning and development encouraged and supported. Very gifted in-house developers and IT supporting a strong network. Automation encouraged.
cons: Originally called Teleglobe, the company was sold and eventually became Tata Communications in 2008. Over the years, the economical reality of employing people based in different locations than Canada became more prominent. Redundancy exercises were on every Montreal but also USA and Europe employees minds and that could create tensions and difficulties.

headline: Bad HR policies, lack of growth in any form
pros: Great work life balance. Cushy job. No pressure.
cons:
HR does not stay on their word, policies are only applicable to the employees however flexible for HR and company. Lack of career opportunities. Low pay. Has not given decent hike to employees for 3 years despite high profits.
They do not let you grow. Always in fire fighting mode, so the opportunities to learn new things are very less. The managers do not create opps to learn either. They have a employee satisfaction survey 2 times a year but implementation of the recommendations take a very long time. In my tenure of more than 3 years, hardly any worthwhile change has happened.
This is a company for people who want a cushy job at the end of their career not for people who want to learn grow and succeed.

headline: IT & Operations are in mess
pros:
Work Life Balance
Good work ethics 
Salary on time
Flexible working hours
cons:
IT team are cheats, they will charge the employee for any minor issues happened to laptops and they will get it repaired only from their vendors at premium cost from the employee. A issue which will cost INR 2k outside for the same IT team will slap you with INR 8K bill

2. The organisation seems paranoid for god knows what reason they have so many authentication stages before you can access your emails, chats, get on a call. Even a word needs to be tagged for level of privacy which makes working and its for everytime you access the file or app during the day. Its very frustrating

3. Operational challenges: SCM team have brain of their own, they dont know their process and it keeps changing as per their own convenience. And marketing team needs to do all these documentations, budget blocking and invoicing by their own.

4. Poor appraisal. You are expected to carry KPIs of someone who is 2 level above you and they will pay you in band which is one level below you.

headline: Worst Management !!
pros: The only pros of working here is stability which is then actually a double edged sword
cons:
There is absolutely no vision with the leaders leading the teams here, no wonder people are leaving - in last 1 month, 10+ people have left the marketing team for good. And its not because of the company - its because of the way of working.

There is absolute chaos and no proper team management. People who head a team have no experience in delegating effectively. Delegation is just an email information and you are expected to work on miniscule information. This is not something with 1 functional head but a behaviour which is across every team.
There is no accountability and everything is either outsourced to an agency or a contract employee who comes at a cheaper price !

Salary is peanuts if you compare with other companies and your peers at the same level. There is a budget cut every year ! But Senior Management does get their crores per annum !

You are not recognised for your past experience but are asked to handle an outsourced agency which you know is payed a premium. There is a total waste of budget without any tangible outcomes - only to fake in internal presentations which are countless. Infact the only thing I learnt in this organisation is to how to fake a presentation by using blown up numbers using some fudged up internal practices which all the Team Heads endorse !!

Campus hires please stay away as you will be stuck here if you don't leave in 2 years !

headline: Pathetic work culture with no dignity at workplace
pros: The only thing good about Tata is the brand name.
cons:
Its my humble request to anyone who are thinking of joining TCL (especially captive SOC project)to not join this company as the work environment is pathetic.
Most of their customers in captive SOC project are very abusive, threatening and there is no dignity or respect of your work.
The policies(especially leave policy) are amended frequently as per their convenience and most of their policies are against the employees.
You have to be pet/puppet of seniors and say yes to each and every decision of theirs even if the decision is not in anyone's favor.
The seniors threaten you with dire consequences if you apply or ask for leave or resign.
There is limited or no career growth or learning and you have to forget about appraisal in this organization.
When you resign they will make sure that you have the most difficult times of your life in getting the FnF and clearance.
You will definitely regret your decision of joining TCL.

Serves over 7,000 customers globally that represent over 300 of the Fortune 500
Connects 4 out of 5 mobile subscribers worldwide
Connects businesses to 80% of the world’s cloud giants
Operates the largest wholly owned and most advanced subsea fibre network which underpins the internet backbone, where its network carries around 30% of the world’s internet routes
Its Internet of Things network in India will be the world’s largest network of its kind, spanning nearly 2,000 communities and touching over 400 million people

headline:
TCTSL(Tata Communications Transformation Services Ltd.) 

"Its like a school!!"
pros: Good to start the career. Onboarding facilities were impressive for hired candidates through on-campusing .
cons:
no career growth, pathetic management. Though they have options to refer employees to explore but they don't do until you do blunder. In short, its not the place for efficient employees, no matter how much appreciations you get from clients, they always have questions to point out and make you feel worthless. 

Here buttering works more than capability. 

They don't value/ appreciate the hard works and do not even try to retain experienced employees. Nothing is transparent here like Appraisal cycle, new opportunity etc.

Completely biased environment!!!you can see people here get promoted/ new opportunity even being bottom performer if manager likes him/her particularly!!

headline: I am working for 5yrs
pros:
•	Effective Contract Management throughout the contract life cycle (1 year and Multi-year Contract)
•	Process automation to reduce TAT in quote preparation and which leads to fastest revenue generation 
•	Effective Pre sales are done to make sure that the order log in should be done on or before fixed TAT
•	Make sure that the quote is converted to Invoice (cash) through strong interlock with Program management team and Billing team
•	Make sure that the contract changes are done and recorded in repository.
•	Customer credibility are measured using KYC process
•	Analysis of Growth and De-Growth in account wise
cons:
•	Proposal management in win win relationship
•	Commercial negotiation and closing the deal according to business expectation 
•	Quote submission in the basis of win-win relation

headline: Dehumanising
pros: Pay is amazing, but I suspect that's more to do with the client
cons: NO work/life balance - they routinely expect us to drop everything for after hours meetings, presentations, etc with same day notice. Mandatory online training courses are hours long and generally have no relevance to day to day duties. No support whatsoever and completely unrealistic demands (eg: needing a signed declaration witnessed by a Justice of the Peace to change my home address with our HR department, being expected to provide specific details of medical prescriptions to management, being expected to provide my high school certificate from 27 years ago upon taking the job, etc)

headline: Unstructured
pros: Company benefits are ok to get by.  If I say people are good, then aren’t we all, only if it’s work that’s where we go bad.
cons:
Having worked here for awhile, it’s very India centric.  Lots of silos, very hierarchical, best friends get better jobs/ promotion, weak change management, HR is in the Stone Age and extremely poor governance.

Don’t recommend if you are not ready for this.  Most leaders are unequiped to manage change, lack know how or the right skills to operate in the regionally.  The local leaders struggle to drive the business because the company lacks governance across all functions.   Leaders driving functional strategies without knowing what’s the value of the roles resulting in a lot of ambiguity.

headline: Terrible Management
pros:
1. Being a part of the Tata conglomerate you get a lot of employee benefits monetary and non-monetary
2. You can work the way you want to. The company provides you a lot of flexibility in terms of work
cons:
1. The culture at the Chennai office SUCKS. These guys hire engineers only from colleges nearby and then cringe about diversity at workplace
2. The management starting from senior vice president, vice presidents, GMs are utterly clueless about what needs to be done and do not take feedbacks in a sporting manner
3. The process implementation is really poor in all the teams. I don't advocate sticking to processes all the time, but there are some checks which are required for hygiene purposes, our guys here omit that part as well because of the casual work culture
4. They focus on the campus hired trainees a lot. That's okay, but in doing that they completely ignore the sincere efforts put by the lateral hires by not rewarding them appropriately. This has resulted in the all time high attrition rate in the company and is also the reason for the lack of worthy and experienced talent in the company which could really add value. What's left is just trash!!

headline: Bad pay -  lethagic/non-competitive management
pros: The brand name Tata. In case you do not like to work hard, this is the place
cons:
1. Bad pay.
2. Bad annual hike, single digit. avg 4-5%
3. Management lacks vision.
4. Not for young/dynamic/talented guys.
5. Still living in stone age and following bell curve for assessment.
6. Very pricey and non-competitive product. Hence its not improving the numbers.
7. No work-life balance
8. CxO's are only focused on expanding office at regional level (Chennai), and thus lacks talented pool which they would have got otherwise.
9. No place to sit in Bangalore office. Employees number > available seats.
10. No peer learning. you may learn better on your own instead.
11. One of the slowest and non productive HR team. Slowest i ever saw in my professional life. Askhr replies seem to be more or less automated.
12. Dont expect to grow until you have grey hair.

headline: Horrible Place to Work
pros: Free booze, and lots of it, at every office function. Pay and benefits are okay. Open plan office if you are into that sort of thing. Interview process is relatively easy, onboarding is quick.
cons: No training is provided whatsoever, so be prepared to be tossed under the bus by the manager you never see when something goes wrong. A real corporate snakepit: I've never met so many backstabbers, bullies, and weasels in my career. Coworkers, especially managers, never have anything nice to say about employees who have left the company.  They are also pretty quick to cut each other up when they think someone is out of earshot. Day to day life at the office can be extremely unpleasant.

headline: Buyer Beware
pros: Excellent benefits package, pay was good provided you reach targets and MBOs, people are friendly for the most part.
cons: Highly dysfunctional global operations and management team wanting to service all global time zones with labor based in India and London.  It doesn't work for employees located far away time zones like western US thereby impacting work/life balance.  And, every month has extreme pressure to meet numbers like the end of a fiscal year, although sales cycle can take months or years to close deals - a huge mismatch between management goals (run by consultants) and reality on the street.  While employees are very polite most of the time, culture is a good news only mentality that avoids critical and sometimes difficult conversations that need to occur for the same of Company survival and growth.

headline: join only as a last option or short term .
pros:
-Nice place to learn things.
-Friendly environment with a beautiful clean and non polluted campus.
- no official time capturing machine to record ur office timing. but ur manager can see your floor timing secretly.
- when ur in office u will be fully work loaded . but when u r in home u will not get call from office any work related. exceptions are there.
- was/is big gaint in telecom labour outsourcing but facing fearce competetion from other vendors in market.
- i will recommnd to join only for short term or if u dont have any better option.
- tries to  maintain male female ration law given by government.
- food pass for onrole emplyees 2500 rs limit per month.
- good to have this comoany name of ur resume if ur in telecom/networking field.
- u will learn how to handle pressure in this company.
- location of company ie dighi is good which almost center of pune.
-Helpful managers
- many diff techlogies operations work under same roof.
- good yearly hikes only for freshers . not for laterals.
cons:
- in past this company was known for job security and people were look at this comapany for settlement in life . for gone those days now.
-Less salary with lots of work load and time consuming processes.
-You will always receive negative ratings and bad appraisal results
-Tremendous work pressure on juniors to team leaders job level category.
-No stability, as multiple layoffs in past few years specially high salary category employees. low salary people have job security here as on 11 june 2018.
- variable part of salary will be zero if u put resign.
- off role employees kept off role for years and give fake promices for making them onrole. only critical resources are made onrole n that also if they put resign.
- i heard not sure that they want to shutdown the company by year 2022 due to losses. 
-on jan 2018 they even hiked company transport charges from 7oo rs per month to 5000 rs per month !. do u believe this ?
- soem projects are of legacy telecom whose experiance dont have any demand outside and u will stuck in this company only.
- where other companies pay night shift allowance 400 rs per night , this company pays 250rs paer night.
- tcts comes under bpo / kpo category.
-Only good is you enter at manager level, bad for entry level engineers who want to grow as they will end up in operations only
-At entry level promotions are rare, operations are usually related to old technology. 
- 60 days on paper leave but u will not able to avail them.
- lots of employees are offrole ie contractual and they always worry loosing  there job.
-No guarantee to become permanent employee for offrole employee

headline: If you like a chaos !
pros: Global exposure, Tata Brand, Good infrastructure, cash rich (by only selling what they had),
cons:
Ever changing senior management, no processes defined, like a start up, low salary hike, no organic talent all work outsourced to agencies

There is no accountability even upto the top most level. From a marketing perspective everything is outsoured to agencies, so if things dont work we blame the agency. There is no organic talent and people who are here for more than 8 years are stuck here forever as they have zero learning and are of no use in the outside world. The digital team is being managed so badly that all the work is outsoured to this one agency which has access to all our systems so for even sending a marketing email it requires a week ! The other teams like F1 , are just cash guzzlers and have no accountability on the business generated for sales.

We are paying a hefty sum to agencies which we should use to hire on-rolls talent and develop the skills of people we already have. 

A company can only grow inside out not the other way.

headline: Not a plesent place to work
pros: I can hardly think of any. The people who are already there, they are trying their best but their frustrations can be seen from day one.
cons:
Plenty of promises of career progression but they only promote Indian employees and look past other nationalities. Very biased in terms of who they progress, never on merit. It’s all about who you know and not about how good you are and what you know. Even HR don’t do much to sort this out and stay quiet in front of Indian leadership team. 
No long term strategy, they hire and fire people on 2 year’s cycles. I’ve seen new people being hired from India to UK office and then redundancies made within 2 months.

headline: Customer Service Executive
pros:
Friendly environment with a beautiful clean and non polluted campus.
2 days off per week. Medium work load and no pressure and headaches.
Salary is decent but not bad. Can take 30 leaves per year.
Dress Code is formals except on Fridays and weekend.
cons: You will always receive negative ratings and bad appraisal results. Lot of politics in managerial dealings. No Bonuses or increments will be given. Only Freshers are entertained in the company and the seniors cannot work there for more than 2 years. Half the new joiner are kept in bench. No trainings will be given properly. Corrupt guys and opportunists who don't have humanness will climb the career ladder. Rewards and recognitions are merely a dog fight among team members.

headline: Not recommended for anyone in the US
pros: Flexible work from home schedule, as most of the team is in India or Singapore, and I enjoyed the people on my team
cons:
All the decisions are made in India and there is a definite bias towards Indian employees.  They are not shy about promoting employees in India and laying off American employees for cost-saving reasons. 

I started a year ago, and in that year, all of the American employees I knew have been laid off. My entire Business Unit was laid off without my knowledge - I found out a week later that I was going to be passed to a completely different team and my team no longer exists. I understand that lay-offs happen, but as a general courtesy I should have been informed. But, as it is working for Tata in the US, we are an after-thought. 

I was excited to work for a global company but this is not a global company and you will not be supported administratively or career-wise if you work in the US.

headline: Dead End
pros: Flexible times, work from home, nice location, beautiful weather, ok compensation
cons: A sense of things going downhill. Almost all work is massively distributed geographically across the world, so there's lots of timezone issues and waits. Decisions happen in silos and you often find out post-fact, too late to contribute, then get blamed for it. Flexible time also means effectively being expected to join in 24/7, usually as per UK or India times. Reviews feel biased, to justify decisions already made. Fine place to vegetate for a while but if you wanna make things happen, have fun working at what you love, or growing your career, look elsewhere. Most good people are already gone. There's also periodic layoffs when budgets overrun. Strong cultural dissonance where management wants to be a global mnc, gives lip service to startup qualities, but operates like a decades old PSU.

Hard for startup and mid small to mid level enterprises to do business with slow response time of product and commercial teams.

headline: Bad experience - Program Management

cons:
Below review is specifically for Delhi Program management team - Enterprise section - under Kunal Roy
1. They expect to come on weekend 
2. High work pressure . Didn't get the idea of targets for a program manager
3. Non supportive management . They just want their targets to be completed and in return you can't expect any appreciation
4. No defined process and management not seems to be bothered by this since their only work is to put pressure on Program managers 
5. No learning in the field of project management . You are just playing a game of passing the ball .it is more of a coordination work then project management .

headline: Could be great, but probably won't be

cons: Internal software is the most complicated mess I've seen in my 20+ year career: people managing hundreds of thousands of dollars have no insight into spend, and each department usually hires a person solely to deal with Finance. IT is scattered and clueless sometimes: It took months to get a phone and internet connection at my desk. The company acts like each penny spent physically hurts, but wants to compete on a world scale. Marketing is ruled by insinuation and hamstrung by infighting among uber-competitive climbers.

headline: Best place to Work
pros:
- Tata take care of its employees, with all benefits & perks
- Yearly hike are also great
- Transparency between different vertical is the best practice followed in Tata
- Interacted with CEO once and very impressed from him. Ground to earth & straight forward.
cons:
- Unfortunately Company own structure is not good, instead of pyramid it is opposite. Means at higher levels DGM & above there are lots of workforce only managing not doing any actual work. while ground force has less head count resulting intense pressure on them.
- Wrong practice followed within team (one of the reason I left from organization) - Instead of giving chance to lower level workforce to come forward & take responsibility, they hire senior level workforce from outside at higher pay grades, resulting dis-satisfaction into employees. These are the employees who worked hard for the team, when there was no one left. 
- Also one thing I felt personally, there is racism within the company. If u are not from Maharashtra (Marathi) senior management sitting in corporate of your team will never trust you. they will give all new projects & opportunities to workforce dear to them. Until & unless you have good senior manager who will fight for ur rights.

headline: Ghost Ship
pros:
One of the pros of working here is that you will learn a keen sense of what it is to run a technology division of a Tier 1 communications company, using the absolutely bare minimum of resources. I've often heard about how painfully under resourced the Russian space program used to be, but I'm rather certain that if we brought a Russian tech worker to this company, they would say things might be bad in Russia, but not this bad :)

Bottom line is this - where the main corporation may or may not be totally healthy (and I have no idea on the status of this) - my position was part of the organization which at this point is kind of like a ghost ship. Nearly all experts have left the company over the past few years, and they're not being replaced by new ones.

Where the lack of leadership is obviously a bad thing, for my case it did bring with it a bunch of flexibility in terms of vacation days, working from home, etc and I was definitely appreciative of that :)
cons: Salaries are 20-30% under market average, in some cases it's even less than that. Where there aren't really many qualified leaders at the upper level, the managers of the various Technology teams try, but can only accomplish so much as they don't really have the backing and full support of the mother ship.

headline: Good Company with few pitfalls
pros:
Good company to work with for couple of years.
Good Work/life balance.
Good BYOD, perks etc policies
Moved to Agile methodology.
Manager Effectiveness survey, which gives visibility to management about how managers are doing.
Rewards & applause
Shape the Future and other idea sharing platform with rewards and recognition.

CEO of the company and team under its direct report is working really hard to turn around things.
cons:
Although moved to agile still water fall model is followed, lack of driving forces.

Where most of the companies are moving away from Bell Curve, TCL has made more stringent in last two years, all the teams can sense the demotivation and frustration of the all the teams. Only top 10% are happy which are best in class for that particular year, rest all highly unsatisfied only because they never know next year they could in bottom performer, the reason is you are not rated for how/what you worked for, but how much important you are for next year. 
Manager Effectiveness Feedback is not continued.
Team are now less focused on work and more on job security due to which politics has gone to peek level

TCL is becoming late adopters(34%) in most of the field.

headline: Worst Experience
pros:
1.Due to TATA's name, people generally get attracted to this company. (me too) & joined.
2.Work from home is allowed. The attendance and leave system is 100% left to reporting manager. ( It has goods and bads too).
3.The salary deductions is far lesser than other companies.So, your take home salary increased.
4.The Sodexho coupon amount is kept outside of CTC. It is really appreciable.
5.You get salary on time. If you are absent and your reporting mgr & leadership is satisfied with your boot licking, you can have 365 days vacation with your family with no pay cuts. :)
cons:
1.Since, Attendance/Leave system is 100% left to manager, he/she can play with your fate/life. He starts treating you like a slave to him. Even if you take it to higher level leadership, he will smile and say, you have to obey your reporting mgr, it is the punishment to you (including abuses and ill treatments).The reporting mgr unfortunately comes from bad mindset, he will screw your personal life too. TATA allows and gives a free hand to them.
2.The Pro VSNL guys/ladies never like TATA mgmt appointed people however, whichever higher qualifications and expertise the guy/girl has.
3.They have IJP (internal job post) only for eye-wash and is to showcase to the world that they are so friendly. Internally, it all happens not based on merits, but with boot licking and personal relationship only it works. You have to be ready to do their personal favours and compromise yourself to max to get POST and POSITIONS (promotions).
4.Every 8 months, new organization restructure happens and the accountable higher rank V.P;s were left with lots of power to bring any changes into the entity without any governance. Low quality and lower rank attitude guys are all brought inside as V.P, with no subject knowledge. Due to this , often re-shuffle to enhance qos, eventually fails, as Pro vsnl guys never engage with them, or allow them to work.
5.When VSNL appointed employees were touched for layoff, your management burned fingers and hands, then, you pulled back with different strategy of accumulating more ppl., leaving all laid off  employees on the street.

headline: Great place for a career to die
pros: Growing company with excellent benefits.   Yearly bonuses.   Health programs and wellness programs are actively encouraged.  Opportunities for advancement for entry and lower level staff.

A place where good careers go to die.  Not enough upward movement for non-Indian employees.  Employee evaluation programs are useless and unfair consider the staff sizes.

headline: I was at Tata Communications for 8 years. This was a mixed time spent.

Training programs and a plenty of them to choose from.
Brand Name.
Various programs and events are organized at different times.
Transport etc. good but chargeable.
cons:
Lower compensation for the entry and mid level employees. This should be made competitive.
Appraisal cycle takes too much of time to complete.
Less or minimum recognition to the employees who have remained with the company for longer years. No long service award etc.
They are now adapting off-role model for cost saving compromising the quality standard.
Operations people do the most but they get the least ;(

headline: CDN engineering group is fast paced, but sometimes a bit small

Management does well investing in their employees, both with good compensation and skill development. I've never felt frustrated nor bored working here. The company seems to be on an upswing at the moment.
cons: The office can sometimes be a little small; with only a few dozen people broken into three sections, you'll see the same faces and have the same conversations a lot. Upper (corporate) management is distant at best, mostly handing down corporate practices that no one follows.

headline: Very engaged/dynamic, but lacking alignment throughout organization to achieve strategic goals.

cons: Working hours can be tough if you work in India based projects; also it is often required to work long hours and on weekends at critical stages of projects. A bit too much emphasis on short-term achievements (e.g. getting product pushed out as soon as possible), rather than making sure foundation is properly in place. Processes often not well defined which makes it difficult to improve them.

headline: Battle between the visionary leadership and morons in middle management
pros: The CEO of the company is very charismatic and a great leader, who has driven a healthy culture of openness and debate in the company. Lots of job security and benevolent culture. People are rarely asked to leave, most people who are put into a performance management process successfully complete it and return to their roles. The culture is largely a can-do spirit, where people's motivation make up for the lack of process. The work pressure is not all that great compared to other companies of similar size and in the same industry, so there is some work-life balance.
cons: The next level down from the CEO (called the G30) and their direct reports are where the company is losing the plot. Tata Comms has in recent months and the past year or so (as of September 2012) hiried a number of senior people from outside - who are overpaid and keen to show some quick results and hence taking the shortest route to results, with all the required shortcuts.

headline: Great CEO, mediocre pay, zero process
pros:
Tata Communications has some great strengths - 

1. The CEO, Vinod Kumar is a great leader and someone who instills confidence. The company is still loss making (in May 2012) and had just turned EBITDA positive, but the employees are overall hopeful under his leadership that the company will turn the corner before the shareholders lose patience.

2. The Tata group culture is evident with its high standard of ethics and values, though this is clearly stronger in India than in other countries.

3. The company has a great asset base - its cable infrastructure, its infrastructure base in India, its reputation within the service provider community

4. It has some great people, who are largely non-political and whom you feel good about working with.
cons:
The company is struggling with some significant downside risks:

1. The level below the CEO - the top 30 managers of the company (called the G30) are a diverse bunch of people with varying levels of competence, politics and values. There are some solid people who deliver upon what the company was known for and there are some newcomers hired in the last 2 years who have brought in a culture of cutting corners and expediency. This layer is very political, with lots of infighting and good skill in positioning themselves, rather than doing good work. 

2. The lack of process is plain to see for anyone. Where there is some process, it seems to have been put in by some evil bumbling bureaucrat - so onerous and misguided, that people mostly look for ways to avoid it. In recent years several senior people have been hired to bring in process rigour, but the lack of process has prevailed - and it seems to be a graveyard for those senior 'business excellence' executives.

3. The salaries are mediocre and pay scales are pegged to the 50th percentile. This may work in India, where the Tata brand is strong and people buy into that as a compensation to lower salaries, but internationally it means that Tata Communications attracts some rather mediocre talent who cling onto the company for dear life
